[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review [/h1]

Counter-Strike: Condition Zero is a game developed and published by Valve, and is the sequel to the classic FPS shooter

The game offers some nice graphics, although some ugly glitches here and there, it is pleasant all the same

Counter-Strike: Condition Zero overall, however, is a fun game to play, and it does get boring if being played for a long time, but is a very good action game and to play in short bursts

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]

TLDR: An underrated classic!

General info
âšªï¸ GENRE:  FPS PVP and PVE team and objective based
âšªï¸ GRAPHICS: Like OG CS but slightly better, typical beginning of 2000s game graphics 
âšªï¸ STATE: Fully released in 2004, still has a small community
âšªï¸ SOUNDTRACK: Typical shooter music with trumpets 

Pros
ğŸŸ¢ Cool Tour Of Duty campaign mode with many missions and challenges 
ğŸŸ¢ High variety of weapons and maps 
ğŸŸ¢ Can be played both online and offline
ğŸŸ¢ Easy to run
ğŸŸ¢ Bots are quite smart (more than CSGO) and can really help you win
ğŸŸ¢ You can download additional campaigns and even make your own! They even bundled the game with a guide 
ğŸŸ¢ All the other pros of CS 1.6

Cons
ğŸ”´ Old and outdated (not a fair con but important nonetheless)
ğŸ”´ The game can be repetitive at times
ğŸ”´ Some sounds are quite annoying (especially with the tutor)
ğŸ”´ The UI is not very intuitive. Beginners may need time to get used to it
ğŸ”´ Most servers are empty. Some are still active though
ğŸ”´ All the cons of CS 1.6

ğŸŸ¢ğŸŸ¢ğŸŸ¢ More pros than cons, but Iâ€™m trying to be equal :)

Final rating: 8/10 If you liked 1.6 youâ€™re gonna love this!

Thanks for reading my review!
